text: In the case of unauthorized charges on your card, you should also report the card as compromised immediately in order to prevent further fraudulent charges. See Replacements for lost or stolen cards .

title: Additional Information
text: The Stripe Corporate Card is free to use. There is no periodic interest because you pay your statement balance in full each month and there are no other fees associated with using the Stripe Corporate Card (e.g., no annual fees, no foreign transaction fees, no late payment fees, and no additional card or card replacement fees).

title: Untitled
text: Once a transaction has been authorized, we are unable to cancel the transaction. We recommend reaching out directly to the merchant to request a refund for the purchase if you need to cancel a charge on your Stripe Corporate Card.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe Corporate Cards do not support PINs at this time, so you will not be asked to set one up. In the case that a merchant asks for a PIN when completing a purchase with your Stripe Corporate Card, we recommend asking them to process the transaction as a chip and signature card (rather than a chip and PIN).

title: Untitled
text: Virtual Stripe Corporate Cards are digital cards that give you the flexibility to make purchases online. They are not tied to specific cardholders. Instead, virtual Stripe Corporate Cards are tied to your Stripe Merchant account and can be set up for specific payments, like recurring subscriptions, and you can designate custom limits in real-time.

title: Untitled
text: Because virtual cards aren’t tied to a specific cardholder, a common naming convention is to use [your Company Name] as a First name and [X_Service_Expense] as a Last name . An example of this is “Stripe Events” or “Stripe Office_Supplies”.

title: Untitled
text: Please note that it is not currently possible to edit the name of a virtual Corporate Card once you’ve created it. If you need to rename a card, you will need to delete the current card and re-create a new one with the new name from your Dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: Restricted Business categories may be imposed through Network Rules or the requirements of our Financial Services Providers. In certain cases, businesses listed in this link may be eligible for processing with explicit prior approval from Stripe. Note, however, that businesses that offer illegal products or services are never eligible to use the Stripe Services. If you are uncertain as to whether your business is a Restricted Business, or have questions about how these requirements apply to you, please contact us.

title: Untitled
text: By registering with us, you are confirming that you will not use the Service to accept payments in connection with restricted businesses, restricted business' activities or practices, unless you have received prior written approval from Stripe. Any balance of payments processed by a restricted business may be held by Stripe to cover eventual disputes.

title: Untitled
text: It is also prohibited to use the Service for any dealings, engagement, or sale of goods/services linked directly or indirectly with jurisdictions Stripe has deemed high risk, such as Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Crimea Region, and Syria.

title: Untitled
text: Once logged in to Xero, click on your organization name on the top left. From there, click Settings > Payment Services > Add Payment Service , and select Stripe ACH bank transfers .

title: Untitled
text: If you are using the “Stripe ACH bank transfers” payment service in Xero, your customers will be able to make partial payments.

title: Untitled
text: However, with the regular “Stripe” payment service, customers can only make full payments on a given invoice at this time. This has been noted as a feature request on the Xero Community page, and looks like it has gotten Xero’s attention. You can record your interest in this functionality here:

title: Untitled
text: This might be because the email address the invoice was sent to does not match the address in the contact record in Xero. Stripe validates the contact’s email address for payment.

title: Untitled
text: Make sure that the email addresses match. A common error is that there might be a trailing space before or after the email address. This issue should be resolved once that space is removed.

title: Untitled
text: Subscription metrics, which measure changes and trends in subscriptions, have been replaced with subscriber metrics, which measure changes and trends in your customers. This provides a better view into what is happening with your enterprise at the customer level. For example:

title: Untitled
text: A customer with one subscription who cancels that subscription, comes back later, and subscribes to another subscription is now tracked as a reactivated subscriber. This reactivated subscriber now remains with its original cohort.

title: Untitled
text: Churn is now calculated at the subscriber level, so a customer who has two active subscriptions would need to churn both in order to count as a churned subscriber

title: Untitled
text: If most of your customers subscribe to only one subscription, this change is unlikely to significantly change your reported metrics.

title: Untitled
text: Events are Stripe’s way of letting you know when something interesting happens in your account. Whenever your account is updated, we create a new Event object and deliver a webhook to any endpoint you’ve configured. For example, when a charge succeeds, we create a charge.succeeded event; and when an invoice payment attempt fails, we create an invoice.payment_failed event.

title: Untitled
text: In live mode, users can only access events created within the last 13 months from the Dashboard . Events older than 30 days will only provide a summary view. Events within the last 30 days will be fully visible via the API and Dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: In test mode, users can only see events created in the last 90 days from the Dashboard . Events older than 30 days will only provide a summary view. Events within the last 30 days will be fully visible via the API and the Dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: When you link an account, you provide access to your bank which Stripe and our Data Sources use to retrieve data about the accounts you specify. Some Data Sources may provide information about additional accounts that are associated with the same login or access method.

title: Untitled
text: When you unlink an account, your merchant won’t be able to access any information about the disconnected account, even if there are remaining accounts associated with the login or access method. But, Stripe and our Data Sources may continue to receive information about the account if you have linked other accounts associated with the same login or access method.

title: Untitled
text: When all accounts associated with the login or access method are disconnected, Stripe and our Data Sources will stop receiving all data for the accounts.

title: Untitled
text: If you change your financial institution login credentials, the type of connection that Stripe and our service providers have to your financial institution will determine if we can still access your linked financial account.

title: Untitled
text: If Stripe and our service providers connect to your financial account via OAuth, the connection will remain active. As long as the token provided by your financial institution remains valid, Stripe will be able to continue accessing your linked financial account and sharing updated data with your merchant.

title: Untitled
text: If Stripe and our service providers connect to your financial account via a method other than OAuth, the connection will be lost if you change your login credentials. Stripe will no longer be able to access your linked financial account or share updated data with your merchant. In these situations, you can reach out to your merchant to re-establish a connection to your account in order to ensure your product experience is not disrupted.

title: Untitled
text: Regardless of whether you change your login credentials, you can request to disconnect a linked financial account and delete any data copied from your account at any time.

title: Untitled
text: After disconnecting your account, the merchant will no longer be able to pull information from your linked account, but may continue to successfully process future payments. Reach out to your merchant if you’d like them to delete any historical information they may have stored on their systems, including information needed to process payments.

title: Untitled
text: If you have disconnected your account and contacted the merchant to delete any copies of your data that they may have created on their systems, you will need to relink your financial account to make future payments.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe builds technology that’s used by millions of companies around the world such as Amazon, Google, and Zoom to handle hundreds of billions of dollars of payments. We help with everything from accepting payments to managing subscriptions and verifying identities.

title: Untitled
text: A business (also known as your merchant) may ask you to link your financial account so the business can accept secure and reliable payments, reduce fraud, assess risk, or help you with financial management. Prior to linking your account, your merchant should let you know why they’re asking you to link an account and tell you what information they are collecting. You can then choose whether to continue.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe and our service providers may also store your financial institution login credentials so we can connect to your financial account and regularly collect updated data that you’ve agreed to share. If Stripe obtains your financial institution login credentials, we do not share them with your merchant.

title: Untitled
text: Although most financial institutions provide Stripe with access to all of the data associated with your accounts, we will only use your financial account information as outlined in our Privacy Policy . We also protect your financial information by only giving your merchant access to the financial information types they’ve specifically requested—and only if you have consented to share that financial information with them through the authentication flow . If your merchant would like to access additional types of data from your account in the future, they will need to obtain your permission.

title: Untitled
text: 1. In Stripe’s authentication flow , you’ll be able to see what data the business is requesting to access, and you’ll be able to choose which account(s) you want to share with the business and Stripe. You can also choose not to link your account.

title: Untitled
text: 3. Stripe provides the business with the data they’ve requested and you’ve agreed to share. You may share the account data that Stripe receives from your financial institution, typically including:

title: Untitled
text: Stripe carefully selects service providers , and they are contractually obligated to only use your financial information to perform services for Stripe or to comply with legal requirements. Service providers are prohibited from selling your financial account information. When you request to disconnect an account from all merchants you’ve linked to via Stripe, our service providers are also required to terminate their Stripe-initiated connection to your account and delete any copies of your information they’ve stored on their systems as a result of you linking via Stripe. Learn more about what happens when you disconnect an account.

title: Untitled
text: We maintain organizational, technical, and administrative measures designed to protect financial account information against unauthorized access, destruction, loss, alteration, or misuse. In particular, all information associated with financial accounts is encrypted in transit and at rest. Because of the sensitive nature of this information, it is also protected by additional access controls, along with ongoing monitoring to prevent data misuse. Learn more about the safeguards we've put in place to protect data transfers and control access.

title: Untitled
text: Our service providers also use encryption to protect your data and are required to protect the security and confidentiality of personal data they process for Stripe. Learn more about security at Finicity and MX .

title: Untitled
text: If you have reason to believe that your interaction with us is no longer secure (for example, if you feel that the security of your bank account has been compromised), please contact us immediately.

title: Untitled
text: We will limit your merchant’s access to only the information they request. We will disclose what types of information your merchant has requested in the authentication flow, and you will have to provide consent before we share this information with your merchant.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe does not sell your financial account information to third parties, including marketers, and we require the same of our service providers. When our service providers obtain your financial account information, they can only use it to perform services for Stripe or to comply with legal requirements.

title: Untitled
text: If you ever want to disconnect a linked financial account or request data deletion, you can fill out this form or contact privacy@stripe.com .

title: Untitled
text: The type of connection that Stripe has with your financial institution determines whether Stripe and our service providers need to access your financial account information by using and storing your login credentials.

title: Untitled
text: An OAuth (Open Authentication) connection is a way for you to log in directly to your financial institution to share information with your merchant and Stripe. This means you don’t have to share your login credentials with Stripe or our service providers.

title: Untitled
text: If neither Stripe nor our service providers can connect to your financial institution via OAuth, then you are sharing your financial institution login credentials with Stripe and one of our service providers when you link a financial account.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe and our service providers will store your credentials using encryption and use them to regularly obtain the updated account information that you’ve consented to share. Learn more about our service providers’ security practices.

title: Untitled
text: You may notice the “Install app” button on an app listing page is disabled. This can be due to any of the following reasons:

title: Untitled
text: Only team members with the Administrator role can install, uninstall, and manage apps for an account. To check if you’re an Administrator for any of your accounts, go to your personal details and scroll down to the Accounts section to see your role in each account.

title: Untitled
text: If your account is connected to a Platform – that is, a third-party that administers payments and data on your account – they may not support app installation for connected accounts.

title: Untitled
text: You cannot install an app on the account that has published it through the Marketplace. The app will already be installed on your account through the upload process. If you wish to test installation of an app you’ve published, you can create a new account .

title: Untitled
text: Electronic invoicing, or “e-invoicing,” means sending or receiving invoices in a standardized, machine-readable electronic format (as opposed to unstructured formats such as email-delivered PDFs or paper invoices).

title: Untitled
text: Requirements for the specific e-invoicing format (such as XML, JSON, or UBL) and the transmission network (such as the global PEPPOL network or SDI in Italy) vary from country to country. For certain regions with e-invoicing mandates, there may also be additional requirements to report e-invoice data to the tax administration (“e-reporting” or “real-time reporting”).

title: Untitled
text: Incorporating e-invoicing into billing processes is increasingly common as it allows for more systematic and consistent tracking of invoices across buyers and sellers. E-invoicing is also mandated for certain types of transactions in an effort to increase tax compliance. Countries that require e-invoices include France, Italy, and Germany in Europe, and Mexico and Brazil in Latin America.

title: Untitled
text: The requirement to use e-invoicing is often limited to specific transaction types (B2B), verticals (government buyers), or cross-border status (domestic sales only).

title: Untitled
text: Consult with your tax or legal advisor to determine whether and which e-invoicing and e-reporting requirements apply to your business per the latest rules and regulations.

title: Untitled
text: A Stripe extension allowed users to sync Stripe data to other business tools, like analytics dashboards, data warehouses, or other 3rd party services. In July of 2022 we launched Stripe Apps , a new way for you to integrate all the tools you use to run your business.

title: Untitled
text: All legacy extensions will be deprecated by 2024. To guarantee continued functionality it is best to update to a Stripe App whenever possible. A complete list of available apps can be found in the Stripe App Marketplace .

title: Untitled
text: If you are already using an extension, those with an available Stripe App can be viewed and upgraded to in the App Settings page in the Stripe Dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: To complete an upgrade from the App Settings page an Administrator can select "Update" next to the desired Stripe App.

title: Untitled
text: Upon choosing to Update, you’ll be prompted to accept permissions. After reviewing and accepting the new permissions, the Stripe App will be installed.

title: Untitled
text: After successfully installing the new Stripe App, you’ll find your new app in the Stripe Apps drawer located on the right side of your dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: Depending on the Stripe App, you may have additional onboarding to complete in the app or the app provider’s service external site.

title: Untitled
text: Apps are installed from the Stripe App Marketplace . If you’re an Administrator for your account, you can use the Marketplace to find the listing page for the app you want to install, click the “Install app” button on the top right, and then review the permissions requested by the app developer as well as the app’s privacy policy.

title: Untitled
text: Apps are installed only for the Account which is currently active in the Dashboard (of which you must be an Administrator), so if you have multiple accounts , you’ll need to switch the account you’re viewing by clicking on the name of your Stripe account in the upper-left corner and then selecting the account you want to switch to.

title: Untitled
text: Once installed, your Stripe Apps will be available on the right-hand sidebar of the Dashboard, unless the app is API-only. Clicking on an app icon will open that app in the sidebar. What the sidebar shows will depend on which dashboard page is currently open. For example, information and operations related to customers can only be displayed on the customer details page.

title: Untitled
text: API-only apps don’t have a graphical interface, and simply grant access to your Stripe data to the app vendor upon your permission. They’re active from the moment they’re installed and don’t require any interaction.

title: Untitled
text: Please visit the app settings page where you can use the “Report app to Stripe” button to submit your concerns about an app. We’re available 24/7 to troubleshoot issues for businesses.

title: Untitled
text: You can let us know about any potential bugs via the contact form on the right-hand sidebar of this support page. Please select “Other” as the topic and in your message provide a detailed report of the issue as well as what page it is on. We’re available 24/7 to troubleshoot issues for businesses.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe apps are built using React , TypeScript , and our own UI and client-side libraries . The setup process is quick and simple for developers.

title: Untitled
text: Once the app is built, you can upload it to your account where it will be available to use in the dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe Apps are currently only available in English. We’re working on localization tools that will allow app developers to translate their apps into other languages.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Automatic tax with Stripe Billing relies on a customer's location to determine the correct tax rate. If a customer’s address, payment method's address, or default payment method is changed or missing, Stripe Tax may not be able to determine a valid tax rate.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: When Stripe Tax can’t determine a tax rate, the subscription invoices stay in "draft" status until you resolve the issue which means subscriptions remain active and payment is not collected, so you may be providing services to these customers without receiving payment.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: You were notified via webhook and email when your first subscription invoice failed to finalize. On November 25, 2024, Stripe is improving product behavior and automatic guardrails to prevent similar issues in the future.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Follow the below steps to 1) identify subscriptions and invoices that failed to finalize, 2) find the reason for their failure, and 3) export this information as a CSV file. You can use the Stripe Dashboard or the Invoicing API.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: You can address the draft invoices you identified in two ways depending on the specific error: whether the invoice requires an updated address or is missing a default payment method. Identify the underlying issue and based on your business need, choose one or more of the solutions described below.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Reattempt payment collection on each invoice with automatic tax by adding the missing details. Alternatively, disable automatic tax before finalizing the invoice.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Before proceeding with any of the below steps, we recommend confirming with the impacted customers that they still intend to subscribe to your service. Failure to do so could result in chargebacks. To try collecting payment:

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: ⚠️ When finalizing the invoice without automatic tax , keep in mind that tax will not be calculated or collected on that invoice. You’ll need to manage any related tax responsibilities. We recommend connecting with your tax advisor for guidance.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: If services weren't provided or if collecting payment is not feasible, cancel the subscription by navigating to the subscription in your Stripe account . It's not possible to void or delete draft subscription invoices so no further action is required.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Our Customer Update API now prevents customers from updating their addresses to invalid locations when they have subscriptions with automatic tax enabled. For invalid addresses, the API returns an HTTP 400 error with the code customer_tax_location_invalid . As before, the Customer Portal validates addresses entered by your customers to ensure they are valid for Stripe Tax.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: When a subscription renews automatically, we'll attempt to calculate tax and finalize the invoice. If tax calculation fails because the customer location is invalid, then automatic tax calculation will be disabled on the invoice and its subscription.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: In this scenario, the invoice will be finalized without calculating or collecting tax, rather than remaining in a “draft” status. This change allows you to collect payment even when tax can't be calculated. You’ll receive events for this change, such as invoice.updated and customer.subscription.updated , showing that automatic tax has been turned off. These allow you to take action on invoices and subscriptions that are missing valid location inputs and re-enable automatic tax for future payments. The automatic_tax[disabled_reason] field will be set to finalization_requires_location_inputs on this invoice. In the case of a missing payment method, the invoice will finalize and payment failures will be retried according to Stripe's standard retry and recovery processes . After reaching the maximum number of attempts, the subscription may transition to a past_due or canceled status, depending on your Billing settings.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: This change does not apply when finalizing an invoice via the Stripe API or Dashboard. In those cases, automatic tax stays enabled if the customer location is missing or not valid, and the finalization fails with a HTTP 400 error.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: To review subscriptions without automatic tax calculations in your Stripe Dashboard, visit your Subscriptions page and filter the view by the Automatic tax not enabled option.

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: To reactivate automatic tax for these subscriptions in the future, ensure that there is at least one valid customer location available. You can then activate automatic tax through the Stripe Tax dashboard .

title: Identifying and exporting unpaid invoices
text: Sales tax, VAT, or GST can’t be retroactively enabled for past invoices. As a merchant, you remain liable for any applicable taxes on sales made prior to the implementation of any tax settings. It is essential to ensure compliance with tax regulations moving forward, and we recommend consulting with a tax advisor to understand your obligations regarding previous transactions. If you have any further questions or need assistance, reach out to our support team.

title: Untitled
text: Our Connect product is a powerful API and set of tools used to route payments between a business, customers, and recipients who need to get paid. It powers payments for business models like marketplaces and software platforms .

title: Untitled
text: It is not possible to create UAE connected accounts where the platform is liable when the connected account can't pay back their losses.

title: Untitled

title: Untitled
text: If the customer’s currency has not yet been set, Stripe will default to showing your account’s default settlement currency when creating an invoice in the dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: If a customer's currency has already been set , Stripe will default to showing that currency when creating an invoice in the dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: You can change the customer's default currency if there are no active subscriptions, quotes or other Billing objects in the customer's current currency. The customer's default currency will be changed when the customer does not have any active subscriptions and you start a new subscription, quote or subscription schedule for the customer in a new currency.

title: Untitled
text: If a customer has any ongoing subscriptions, you can cancel existing subscriptions and re-create them in a different currency t o change the customer's default currency. The currency cannot be updated on an ongoing subscription.

title: Untitled
text: You can create one-off invoices in a currency that's different than the customer's default currency . This feature is available both in Invoices API and in the dashboard for one-off invoices. It is not supported in subscriptions currently.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: Your satisfaction matters. We are committed to giving you great service. In order to do this we need you to let us know when we get things wrong. We want to help you resolve your complaint as quickly as possible.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: We treat any expression of dissatisfaction with our services or products as a complaint and will aim to respond. We listen to your complaints, treat them seriously, and learn from them so that we can continuously improve Stripe.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: We aim to respond to your complaint as quickly as possible and in accordance with any requirements under law. If we are unable to resolve your complaint instantly, we will send an acknowledgement of your complaint within 5 business days of receiving it. Residents of or businesses based in Malaysia, however, will receive an acknowledgment of your complaint within 2 business days. Residents of our businesses based in Australia will receive an acknowledgment within 1 business day and residents of our business based in India and Brazil will receive an acknowledgment within 24 hours.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: We will have a qualified representative to complete a fair and thorough investigation. In most cases, we will provide a written Final Response to your complaint within 15 business days of receiving it, depending on its complexity. Residents of or businesses based in Brazil, however, will receive a written Final Response within 10 business days.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: In exceptional circumstances we may need more time to complete our investigation. If this happens, we will let you know and explain our reasons. In most cases, our written Final Response will not exceed 35 business days from the date we received your written complaint. However, we adjust this deadline in accordance with requirements under the law for the following regions:

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: If you are dissatisfied with our Final Response to your complaint, laws may provide you with the right to refer your complaint to a complaint agency or regulator.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for Stripe users based in Australia that receive regulated financial services from Stripe Payments Australia Pty Ltd (SPAPL). If you have made a complaint to SPAPL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to the Australian Financial Complaints Authority . You can find further information on SPAPL’s Complaint Handling Policy and further information on referring your complaint to Australian Financial Complaints Authority here .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for Stripe users based in Brazil that are serviced by Stripe Brasil Participações Ltda. (SBPL). If you have made a complaint to SBPL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to Stripe’s Ombudsman in Brazil . You can find further information on referring your complaint to Stripe’s Ombudsman in Brazil here .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: SPCL has established a process for managing potential Code of Conduct for the Payment Card Industry compliance violations. If you have a complaint about a particular element of the Code, read about how to file a complaint in Canada .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for Stripe users based in EEA countries that receive regulated financial services from Stripe Technology Europe Limited (STEL). If you have made a complaint to STEL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to the Financial Services and Pensions Ombudsman within 6 years of the date of the conduct complained of. You can find further information on STEL's Complaints Handling Policy here and further information on referring your complaint to the Financial Services and Pensions Ombudsman here .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: In addition to the methods mentioned above, you may also submit a complaint by phone (toll-free) at +33 805 11 19 67 Monday through Friday 9am-5pm GTM (except public holidays) or by postal mail at Stripe Payments Europe, Ltd. 10 Boulevard Haussmann, 75009 Paris, France.

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for French users that receive regulated financial services from Stripe Technology Europe Limited (STEL). If you have made a complaint to STEL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to the Financial Services and Pensions Ombudsman within 6 years of the date of the conduct complained of. You can find further information on STEL's Complaints Handling Policy here and further information on referring your complaint to the Financial Services and Pensions Ombudsman here .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for Stripe users based in India that are serviced by Stripe India Private Ltd. (SIPL). If you have made a complaint to SIPL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to the Nodal Officer. You can find further information on referring your complaint to the Nodal Office here .

title: Ways to submit a complaint
text: This information is for Stripe users based in the United Kingdom, Switzerland or Gibraltar that receive regulated financial services from Stripe Payments UK Limited (SPUKL). If you have made a complaint to SPUKL and are not satisfied with the response received, you can refer your complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service free of charge within 6 months of our final response to your complaint. You can find further information on SPUKL’s Complaints Handling Policy and further information on referring your complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service here .

title: Untitled
text: If we cannot provide a response within twenty business days, you will be informed of the delay, the reason for the delay and the expected response time.

title: Untitled
text: Nothing restricts you from directly filing a complaint with FCAC at any stage of the complaint process to investigate non-compliance with the Code. FCAC can be reached via:

title: Untitled
text: Although FCAC does not act as a complaint resolution body, FCAC may open an investigation to determine if the issues identified in a merchant complaint reflect a Payment Card Network Operator non-compliance with Code obligations.

title: Untitled
text: The Restricted Business List reflects that it is prohibited to use Stripe’s products and services to directly or indirectly export, reexport, sell or supply architectural services or engineering services, quantum computing services, information technology (IT) consultancy and design services, IT support services and cloud-based services for enterprise management software and design and manufacturing software to any person located in the Russian Federation.

title: Untitled
text: In the European Union and the United Kingdom, it is prohibited to use Stripe’s products and services, directly or indirectly, to provide credit rating services, market research and public relations services, advertising services, auditing services, or legal advisory services to any person in Russia.

title: Untitled
text: Further, the Restricted Business List has been updated to include that Stripe’s products and services may not be used for any goods (luxury goods, sensitive goods included in the Common High Priority Items List, enterprise management software and design software) that are prohibited by law in relation to Russia.

title: Untitled
text: It is also prohibited to use Stripe’s services for any dealings, engagement, or sale of goods/services linked directly or indirectly with the Luhansk, and Donetsk, and Crimea regions. It is prohibited to use Stripe’s products and services to directly or indirectly export, reexport, sell, or supply accounting, trust and corporate formation, or management consulting services to any person located in the Russian Federation.

title: Untitled
text: Given the fluid nature of the situation, we continue to closely follow regulatory developments implicating our sanctions obligations and encourage you to do the same. Find the latest information about which jurisdictions Stripe considers to be prohibited by reviewing our Restricted Business List .

title: Untitled
text: In February 2024, the Canadian Ministerial Directive on Russia imposed additional enhanced due diligence requirements for every financial transaction originating from or bound for Russia, regardless of its amount. In compliance with the Canadian Ministerial Directive on Russia and stricter risk requirements from our Canadian financial partners, Stripe prohibits payment acquiring from Russia for all users in Canada.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe currently does not support users located in Russia, Ukraine and Belarus. All major credit card networks are no longer providing services to Russian financial institutions. Additionally, Stripe will not process transactions involving sanctioned Russian and Belarusian financial institutions and does not support the Mir card payment system. This means transactions involving Russian-issued cards are unlikely to be successful. We encourage you to ensure compliance with relevant sanctions regulations in your jurisdiction.

title: Untitled
text: In 2022–2023, sanctions were issued that prohibit certain products and services related to accounting services, management consulting, trust and corporate formation services, architecture services and engineering services, quantum computing services from being offered to persons located in Russia. In 2024, additional sanctions were issued that prohibit certain products and services related to the provision of information technology (IT) consultancy and design services as well as IT support services and cloud-based services for enterprise management software and design and manufacturing software to persons in Russia. Given the new prohibitions, persons located in Russia may no longer use in-scope Stripe products. Stripe users cannot use Stripe products and services for activity related to the above services from persons located in Russia.

title: Untitled
text: A lien can be placed on a person or legal entity as a legal claim to secure payment of a debt or services. Stripe is obliged to act on liens it receives by blocking payouts from the user’s Stripe balance to their bank account, and in some cases, remitting funds back to the creditor who puts the lien in place. Liens apply to all Stripe accounts that have information which matches the lien. In the case of multiple competing liens, the creditors must agree on the order of repayment and communicate it to Stripe.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe is unable to remove a payout block on an account until we have received an official lien release notice from the creditor who put the lien in place. The person or entity subject to the lien must work with this creditor (or their legal representative) to ensure the lien is resolved and released.

title: Untitled
text: The creditor (or their legal representative) must provide Stripe with a signed copy of the lien release. Assuming there are no other competing blocks on the account, Stripe will re-enable payouts within 5 business days. The release must come from the creditor . You are responsible for ensuring the creditor sends the release form. Find the name of the creditor Stripe received the lien from by searching the account’s ID in your Dashboard under the Payouts paused due to lien notice.

title: Untitled
text: A lien is a claim against property or funds to secure payment of a debt. In contrast, a levy is the actual seizure of property/funds to satisfy a debt. Levies are typically sent to Stripe by the government and we are obliged to act on them by blocking payouts from a Stripe account to a bank account and/or remitting funds to the relevant government agency. Levies apply to all Stripe accounts that have information which matches the levy. An entity can have multiple competing levies.

title: Untitled
text: Once funds up to the amount specified in the levy have been remitted to the government agency and a release is sent by that government agency to llg-notices@stripe.com the levy will be resolved. Assuming there are no other competing blocks on the account, Stripe will re-enable payouts within 5 business days. The release must come from the government agency . You are responsible for ensuring they send the release form. Find the name of the agency Stripe received the levy from by searching the account’s ID in your Dashboard under the Payouts paused due to levy notice.

title: Untitled
text: We support our UK and Gibraltar Stripe users through our regulated Electronic Money Institution (EMI) in the UK (Stripe Payments United Kingdom Ltd. or “Stripe”).

title: Untitled
text: Stripe is not a bank and, therefore, we do not hold your funds as a deposit to use for our own purposes or to lend to other users.

title: Untitled
text: To ensure that your funds are safe, we follow a process known as ‘safeguarding’ which is an important regulatory requirement for all EMIs.

title: Untitled
text: This means that we keep sums received from or held for our users in connection with payments processing or the issuing of e-money separate from our own funds. We have detailed processes & procedures around safeguarding. For example, we have established dedicated safeguarding bank accounts with credit institutions.

title: Untitled
text: No. As Stripe is an EMI, it isn’t covered by the Financial Services Compensation Scheme . This is an independent scheme which helps eligible customers get their funds returned (up to a certain limit) in the event of a failure of a firm covered by the scheme.

title: Untitled
text: No action is needed from you. We are publishing this communication to ensure that you understand how we safeguard your funds.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe is privately owned, and as such investment in Stripe stock is only available to a small number of investors, most of whom are well known to us.

title: Untitled
text: We have become aware of certain investment funds that do not own any Stripe stock claiming to offer retail investors access to Stripe. The basic premise tends to be something like, “you can’t get direct access to Stripe, but invest in us and we will get it for you.” And yet, these firms do not themselves have access to Stripe stock. If these funds claim to have found some way to indirectly invest in Stripe via others who do own Stripe stock, we cannot vouch for the legality of their claims or the value of their supposed investments. Indeed, if they are relying on “forward” contracts or other mechanisms that attempt to circumvent the rights of first refusal, transfer restrictions, and other terms and conditions applicable to investment in Stripe stock, their investments may have no value at all, as explained in this article .

title: Untitled
text: If you have concerns about a fund that is claiming to have access to Stripe stock and marketing that access to retail investors, please contact us at legal-corporate-confidential@stripe.com .

title: Untitled
text: If anyone is claiming to sell you shares of Stripe stock (vs. an investment in a fund that claims to own shares), please see this article .

title: Frequently asked questions
text: Every year, thousands of websites suffer from data breaches. The credentials on these websites are often included in such data breaches, and criminals attempt to use these credentials to compromise other websites in hopes that the same credentials are reused.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: To protect our users, Stripe proactively monitors the dark web for data exposed from other websites' breaches. When we find a credential in the exposed data that matches your Stripe credentials, we will disable your password so that an attacker can't use the same breached data to sign in as you.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: No. If you received the email above, then your credentials were exposed in a past data breach from another website, and you reused the same credentials on Stripe. For your protection, we've temporarily disabled Dashboard access to your Stripe account until you reset your password.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: Stripe is proactively monitoring for leaked credentials from past data breaches that may be used to compromise your account. So far, we have no reason to believe your account has been accessed without your authorization.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: We strongly recommend that you use a unique password for Stripe and don't reuse it elsewhere. To facilitate remembering unique passwords, we suggest a password manager. For more details, see our best practices for storing your Stripe password .

title: Frequently asked questions
text: Furthermore, enabling two-step authentication —if you haven't already done so—will ensure that compromising your password alone is insufficient to compromise your account.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: Stripe will not permit you to change your password to something already known to be exposed in a data breach.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: However, if you choose to not use a password manager, we recommend that you choose at least four random words from the dictionary and use them as your password. You can use websites such as correcthorse.pw to securely generate such passwords.

title: Frequently asked questions
text: Websites like Have I Been Pwned are designed to specifically monitor data breaches on behalf of users and may be able to provide more information on any data breach that affected you.

text: Before getting started with your Stripe account, make sure your business is not listed in our restricted business list .

title: Untitled
text: Behind the scenes, we work closely with payment networks (such as Visa and Mastercard) and banking partners across more than two dozen countries. Each institution has strict legal regulations that govern them and specific rules about the types of businesses they do and do not work with. Through our partnerships, we are bound to uphold those requirements. In addition, we must also—of course—uphold the laws of the countries we operate in. Lastly, we need to be careful regarding the financial risks that different businesses may pose to their customers or to Stripe.

title: Untitled
text: In certain cases, businesses listed in this link may be eligible for processing with explicit prior approval from Stripe. However, businesses that offer illegal products or services are never eligible to use the Stripe Services. If you are uncertain as to whether your business is a Restricted Business, or have questions about how these requirements apply to you, please contact us .

title: Untitled
text: By registering with us, you are confirming that you will not use the Service to accept payments in connection with restricted businesses, restricted business' activities or practices, unless you have received prior written approval from Stripe. Any balance of payments processed by a restricted business may be held by Stripe to cover eventual disputes.

title: Untitled
text: It is also prohibited to use the Service for any dealings, engagement, or sale of goods/services linked directly or indirectly with jurisdictions Stripe has deemed high risk, such as Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Crimea Region, and Syria.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe may also require additional licenses for businesses in Thailand from certain industries. Because of this requirement, Stripe will not be able to support any Custom or Express accounts from these industries.

text: Connect configurations that do not rely on onboarding built by Stripe are currently only available for certain use-cases in India . Please reach out to our sales team if you are interested in this feature.

title: Untitled
text: When onboarding accounts to a Connect platform using this integration type, you need to collect the required information for each account (which Stripe verifies) and submit it using the Accounts API. The information you need to collect depends on factors such as the capabilities you want to activate for the account and the country the account is based in.

title: Untitled
text: If you're leveraging onboarding built by Stripe, you don't need to collect information as Stripe does that for you, however, you can review what information is being collected from your users on this page.

title: Untitled
text: Verification attempts can take minutes or, if it's a manual review, hours to complete. If Stripe is unable to verify the information, the account is updated and a webhook is sent to your platform.

title: Untitled
text: company.vat_id Optional: GST Identification Number can be used to verify the identity of your business. Additionally, GST can be used for e-invoicing purposes.

title: Untitled
text: If Stripe is unable to verify the company, its representatives or beneficial owners, you need to provide a scan of an ID document . This can be collected with the verification.document.front and verification.document.back arguments.

title: Untitled
text: Acceptable ID documents vary by country . There are some forms of identification that require scans of both the front and back of the ID. For these, use the document_back parameter to provide the back of the document. Unless explicitly noted, only a scan of the front of the ID is required. Beyond a certain threshold, this will lead to payouts being paused until we receive a soft copy of the necessary documents. During this time, be assured that there will be no disruption in your ability to collect payments.

text: A business incorporated under the Companies Act 2013 that limits owner liability to their shareholdings, the number of shareholders to 200, and restricts shareholders from publicly trading shares.

title: Untitled
text: A business registered under the Limited liability Partnership Act 2008 with a minimum of two partners, a minimum of two designated partners who are individuals, and at least one of them resident in India.

text: You will be provided with a monthly tax invoice for the GST that is charged on your Stripe fees. Learn more about tax invoices .

title: FAQ
text: Fees for Stripe Tax are automatically deducted from your Stripe Balance, and are based on the location of the merchant, regardless of where the transaction takes place. For example, a merchant based in the US, selling products to various countries, will be charged in USD. While the prices in this article are listed in USD, a merchant will be charged in their local currency.

title: FAQ
text: This is an annual contract, paid monthly. The option to sign up for Tax Complete is only available if it's supported in your region. If eligible, sign up or switch to a subscription-based plan from the Your plans page in the Stripe Dashboard. The monthly subscription fee is deducted from your Stripe Balance at the start of each billing period. Any overage fees, and additional fees for registrations and filings outside of the US, are deducted after the billing period ends.

title: FAQ
text: Tax Complete offers four pricing tiers. Each tier includes a set number of tax registrations, transactions, calculations, and filings. Overage fees may apply if you exceed these limits.

title: FAQ
text: Registrations in the US for remote sellers are provided by Stripe and registrations outside the US are provided by Taxually. Registrations are priced on a per-registration basis and depend on the location of the registration. Your subscription tier includes a set number of registrations.  If you complete a registration outside the US, the "Additional registration fee" applies (see table below). If you exceed the number of registrations in your subscription tier, the "Overages" fee applies for each additional registration.

title: FAQ
text: Registrations outside of the US will still count toward your limit. For instance, on the 90 USD subscription plan, you receive 2 registrations per year. You can register in a US state at no additional cost and also register in Colombia for an additional cost of 1050 USD.

title: FAQ
text: Filing services are provided by our filing partner, Taxually . Filing is priced on a per-filing basis, and depends on the location of the filling. Your subscription tier includes a set number of filings. If you complete a filing outside the US, an "Additional filing fee" applies (see table below). If you exceed the number of filings in your subscription tier, the "Overages" fee applies for each additional filing.

title: FAQ
text: Filings outside of the US will still count toward your limit. For instance, on the 90 USD subscription plan, you receive 4 filings per year. You can file in two US states at no additional cost, file in Mexico for an additional cost of 945 USD, and file monthly in Colombia for an additional cost of 45 USD per year.

title: FAQ
text: PAYG pricing is usage-based and determined by the number of transactions or the sales volume that you process through Stripe Tax for tax calculation and collection. You only incur fees for transactions in jurisdictions where you have an active tax registration. The pricing differs based on the type of integration you use (no-code vs API).

title: FAQ
text: PAYG pricing for Stripe Tax no-code integration is 0.5% of the volume processed, in jurisdictions where you are registered to collect tax. This volume includes the complete transaction amount, including any calculated sales tax.

title: FAQ
text: Stripe Tax provides two distinct APIs: Calculations API and Transactions API . Both APIs are priced based on the number of API calls you make.

title: FAQ
text: Fees for the API are specific to each market and based on the location of the merchant, regardless of where the transaction takes place. For example, a merchant based in the US, selling products to various countries, is charged in USD for all transactions.

title: FAQ
text: With every Transaction API call, you receive up to 10 Calculation API calls for free. If you exceed the 10 Calculation API calls per Transaction API call, 0.05 USD is charged per additional Calculation call. This is aggregated on a monthly basis.

title: FAQ
text: Stripe Tax API customers are charged on a daily basis for all Calculation and Transaction API calls made. At the end of each calendar month, a rebate is applied if there’s a difference in Calculation API calls. Rebates are typically completed by the end of the month, followed by an additional three business days. Unused Calculation API calls don’t carry over to the next month.

title: FAQ
text: You have the flexibility to activate Stripe Tax for specific transactions as needed. However, Stripe Tax automatically identifies multiple locations to ensure that your transactions are monitored correctly against local registration thresholds and that you always charge customers the right amount of tax. We want to make it easy for you to comply with taxes across all your transactions, so we recommend using Stripe Tax on all your transactions where you have passed a tax threshold and have an active registration.

title: FAQ
text: No, the Stripe Tax Transaction API call is independent from a successful payments transaction. You need to call the Transaction API specifically for Stripe Tax. This is consistent for all Stripe API products.

title: FAQ
text: Yes, users on a custom pricing plan for tax calculations can purchase registrations and filings directly in the Dashboard . You'll be charged the overage rates mentioned above. Custom pricing is available for companies with large payments volume, high-value transactions, or unique business models.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: The Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports using the Avalara AvaTax connector to calculate tax with Avalara on Stripe invoices. The NetSuite connector syncs these invoices to NetSuite and records the calculated tax.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: The Avalara AvaTax connector calculates the tax and then adds it to the Stripe invoice as a standalone invoice item. Stripe invoices must remain open for a period of time for Avalara to apply the calculated tax amount. The tax amount appears as an additional line item (or Stripe Invoice Item) labeled Sales Tax .

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: To use this functionality, enable the pay_immediately parameter on your account. Tax calculation then occurs automatically after the first billing cycle. You can also calculate tax with just a postal code. Consult your tax professional about the best approach for your business.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: Avalara has limited support for the Avalara Connector for Stripe Invoicing and use of this connector with the Stripe Connector for NetSuite is at your own risk.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: You must have an Avalara test environment to fully test the Stripe Connector for NetSuite with Avalara. Stripe live mode and test mode transactions can’t process at the same time.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: When you successfully integrate Avalara with Stripe, address information gets added on Stripe customer metadata fields that are specific to Avalara. When Stripe initiates a subscription, we make sure tax gets added to a payment by using the pay_immediately: false parameter to delay immediate payment. When Stripe generates an invoice for the next subscription billing period, an Avalara line item gets added automatically to the Stripe invoice.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: Avalara doesn’t automatically receive webhooks from your Stripe account. You must manually add the Avalara webhook URL to each environment that you want to test Avalara. To do so, copy the Avalara webhook endpoint from the AvaTax setup and add it to the Stripe webhooks admin ( API > Webhooks ).

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: To process test webhooks, connect to Avalara’s sandbox system through the AvaTax for Stripe dashboard. You can only connect to one Avalara environment at a time. Learn about how to use Avalara AvaTax for tax calculation.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: If you use a tax engine in NetSuite, it likely calculates and records taxes due on any invoices created in NetSuite. If you use Stripe Billing invoices, Avalara calculates and records the tax amount before the invoice syncs to NetSuite. To make sure that Avalara doesn’t calculate taxes in NetSuite, the connector sets the tax code on the invoice and line item level to Not Taxable .

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: If a Stripe price links to a NetSuite item that has an AvaTax tax code, the Avalara tax system overrides the Stripe Connector defaults and calculates the tax twice. Make sure that all NetSuite items linked to Stripe prices don’t have an AvaTax tax code.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: Stripe represents the taxes calculated by Avalara as a Stripe Tax line item on the NetSuite invoice. You can rename the line item, edit the liability account, or edit other aspects of the item. Customize the name and account to align with how you manage taxes in NetSuite.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: If you use Avalara outside of the NetSuite environment to calculate tax, you can’t use the Avatax sales tax item to represent tax in NetSuite. This special tax item triggers a call to Avalara that records the taxes for that order again. Taxes calculated by Avalara outside of NetSuite aren’t represented by tax codes or groups.

title: Learn how the Stripe Connector for NetSuite supports the Avalara AvaTax Connector for Stripe Invoicing to calculate tax.
text: The Avalara Connector has a race condition to consider. If you use the invoice.created webhook, Avalara might calculate taxes after you add usage-based billing through Stripe standalone invoice items. This means tax might not calculate and record properly.

title: Untitled
text: Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products, which include revenue products like Billing, fraud prevention products like Radar, reporting products like Tax, and analytics products like Sigma, are subject to GST/HST. Starting June 1, 2023, we will begin applying these taxes as required to Stripe account holders in Canada. We’re currently charging GST/HST on sales of Terminal hardware and accessories (based on the ship-to address of each order), and will continue to do so.

title: Untitled
text: Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products, which include  revenue products like Billing, fraud prevention products like Radar, reporting products like Tax, and analytics products like Sigma, are subject to PST in certain provinces. This PST is in addition to the 5% GST that will be charged in these provinces.

title: Untitled
text: We will continue to charge PST on sales of Terminal hardware and accessories shipped to addresses in British Columbia, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba.

title: Untitled
text: No, this change pertains solely to Stripe Fees that we charge for the products and services that Stripe provides to you.

title: Untitled
text: Merchant acquiring/payment processing service provided by Stripe to you in Canada are not impacted and continue to be treated as exempt (not subject to tax).

title: Untitled
text: You will be charged GST/HST, and PST where applicable, on Stripe fees for SaaS products provided by Stripe. You will receive a tax invoice detailing the taxes and amounts charged by Stripe to you. You may be able to recover the GST/HST charged based on your Canadian registration status.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe Payments Canada Ltd is registered for taxes in Canada so we will therefore charge and collect taxes on fees to Stripe merchants in Canada as required.

title: Untitled
text: Tax Invoice is a monthly document issued to account holders in Canada which outlines the fees subject to GST/HST, and where applicable, PST.

title: Untitled
text: Maintaining this Tax Invoice is one of the requirements to receive an input tax credit (ITC) for GST/HST. If you have any queries in relation to your entitlement to reclaim GST/HST, we recommend consulting with your accountant or tax advisor. For more information, see our support page.

title: Untitled
text: If you have further questions on Stripe’s tax policy (e.g., if you believe you’re exempt from tax), please contact us. Please note that Stripe cannot provide tax advice. We recommend that you speak with a tax advisor for more assistance.

title: Untitled
text: In order to comply with the Mexican Tax authorities regulation, Stripe is requiring all accounts based in Mexico to upload their "Constancia de Situación Fiscal" in PDF format through their Stripe Dashboard by March 31, 2023.

title: Untitled
text: If you fail to upload your Constancia de Situación Fiscal and update your tax información through your Stripe Dashboard by March 31, 2023, Stripe will not be able to issue your monthly IVA Invoices. Instead, Stripe will include your fees and tax information in a monthly global invoice issued to the general public, in this case it might be possible that you won't be able to make certain tax deductions or credits for your company.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe has been requesting all accounts based in Mexico to upload their “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” through their Stripe Dashboard since March 31, 2023. Any document uploaded after this date will be considered as a late submission. In order to comply with the safety and privacy of your data, Stripe will only accept documents sent through your Stripe Dashboard.

title: Untitled
text: If you still have questions or wish to know more information about this process, read through our frequently asked questions below:

title: Untitled
text: The "Constancia de Situación Fiscal" is an official document issued by the Mexican Tax Regulator, SAT, that contains tax information about Mexican tax payers incorporated to the SAT.

title: Untitled
text: If you still haven't downloaded or have misplaced your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal”, please review this video tutorial to learn how to generate and download your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” through the SAT online portal .

title: Untitled
text: Your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” has to be up to date, fully legible and in PDF format when uploading. This data recollection process is mandatory and within compliance to the new regulations imposed by Mexican Tax Regulators, SAT.

title: Untitled
text: In order to comply with the new regulation, Stripe is requesting for all Mexico accounts to upload a valid “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” PDF document via the Stripe Dashboard by March 31, 2023.

title: Untitled
text: If you do not upload your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” via the Stripe Dashboard by March 31, 2023, Stripe will not be able to issue monthly CFDI invoices for your account. Instead, Stripe will have to include your account’s fees as part of the global invoice that Stripe Payments Mexico S de RL de CV issues on a monthly basis to the general public, using a generic RFC. As a result, if you do not upload your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” document, you may not be able to claim certain tax credits and deductions for your business.

title: Untitled
text: You need to upload an updated “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” each time your tax information is updated in the SAT’s official records, such as if you change your tax address, tax ID, or tax regime.

title: Untitled
text: If you need to obtain the most up-to-date version of your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” document, you can download it from the SAT webpage . You can watch this video tutorial to review how you can do that.

title: Untitled
text: If you still have a question or concern about the new CFDI 4.0 version, how to upload your “Constancia de Situación Fiscal” or how to get your monthly CFDI invoices for your Stripe account, please contact our support team via https://support.stripe.com/?contact

title: Untitled
text: Stripe will issue you a Faktur Pajak, which may allow the VAT paid to be claimed as part of your regular VAT return process. The tax invoice will be sent to your email address by the end of each month.

title: Untitled
text: “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations for payments require Stripe to collect and maintain information on all Stripe account holders. These requirements come from our regulators and are intended to prevent abuse of the financial system, provide your potential customers with clear and useful information, and prevent material loss to your business or to Stripe. You can read more on that here .

title: Untitled
text: The information Stripe is required to collect differs from country to country, and typically includes (but is not limited to):

title: Untitled
text: If, at any time, we are unable to confirm that your business meets these checks or requirements, we may ask you to send us more information or fix the problem. Depending on the severity of the issue, your account may not be able to process payments or receive transfers until the issue is resolved. We will let you know if that’s the case.

title: Untitled
text: We do not use this information for any other purposes, and we take your privacy and the security of your data very seriously.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe’s security tools and best practices ensure that your sensitive information is safely stored and encrypted. You can read more on that here . You can learn more about the safeguards we've put in place to protect your information in our Stripe Privacy Center .

title: Untitled
text: Users in certain countries may be able to regenerate a tax invoice if their business or tax information has changed. You can regenerate a tax invoice from your dashboard under the Documents section of your Settings page.

title: Untitled
text: You can export all of the transactions that make up your individual payouts using the Payout Reconciliation report available in the financial reports section of your Stripe Dashboard

title: Untitled
text: A new “Qualified Invoice System” has been introduced in Japan, effective from October 1, 2023. Stripe Japan, Inc. has been registered as an issuer of qualified invoices , and issues compliant qualified tax invoices for transactions (available on the 10th of the following month). Stripe account holders in Japan can download their qualified tax invoice every month from the Dashboard (Settings > Reporting and Documents > Documents).

title: Untitled
text: The month in which the Stripe fees were debited from your account, based on the date and time when the balance transactions were ‘Created’.

title: Untitled
text: Note: The Coordinated Universal Time / UTC timezone is used to determine which balance transactions should be included in tax invoices.

title: Untitled
text: Stripe calculates and rounds JCT at the overall invoice level to the nearest yen in accordance with the National Tax Agency’s requirements.

title: Untitled
text: Please note, if the invoice includes multiple currencies, there may be a slight difference between: the Total JCT and the sum of the JPY equivalent of the JCT for each currency. The Total JCT figure should be used for tax purposes.

title: Untitled
text: Total tax amount we collected from your account based on JCT that is calculated at the same time that the respective product fees are calculated throughout the month (“total transaction-level JCT”)

title: Untitled
text: Stripe calculates and rounds JCT at the overall invoice level to the nearest yen in accordance with the National Tax Agency’s requirements. When there is a difference between total transaction-level JCT and invoice-level JCT, we will credit the difference in the month the invoice is issued, which is the month following the ‘Service Month’.

title: Additional Information
text: This will only affect the times displayed in your dashboard and will not affect your reporting exports , the times returned by the API, or the timing of your subscriptions and transfers. These will remain in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).
